availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Jacob C. Hess (Dover, Kentucky, police judge)

body.p: Dover, Kentucky, police judge. Virginia native.Married to America "Mary" Thomas Hess in Mason County, Kentucky on October 6, 1840. Father of Sarah and Viola Hess. Wharf master in Mason County, Kentucky in 1850. Police Judge of Dover in September 1863. Worked in wharf boats and livery in Mason County in 1860. Appointed Dover postmaster on September 10, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Ancestry.com. U.S., Appointments of U. S. Postmasters, 1832-1971 [database on-line]. Provo, UT, USA: Ancestry.com Operations, Inc., 2010. Original data: Record of Appointment of Postmasters, 1832-1971. NARA Microfilm Publication, M841, 145 rolls. Records of the Post Office Department, Record Group Number 28. Washington, D.C.: National Archives, Dover, Mason County, KY, Volume 28, 10 Sep 1864, p. 137.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mason, District 1, p.21B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, Dover, 3rd District, p. 51.
Jacob C. Hess obituary, The Maysville, Kentucky Evening Bulletin, 10 May 1886, 3, https://www.newspapers.com/image/78160993/?terms=%22Jacob%2BC%2BHess%22 (accessed 16 May 2017).
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, X County Marriages, Film #000281843
